mission: Design, implement, and optimize scalable go-to-market systems that enable the Commercial team to efficiently acquire, convert, and retain customers while driving predictable revenue growth.

outcomes.name: GTM Infrastructure Buildout
outcomes.description: Develop and maintain the technical and operational infrastructure that supports go-to-market motions across sales, marketing, and customer success.
successCriteria: Core GTM tools (CRM, marketing automation, data stack) are implemented and fully operational
Automations reduce manual GTM workflows by at least 30%
Documentation exists for all core GTM systems and processes

outcomes.name: Revenue Process Optimization
outcomes.description: Improve end-to-end revenue processes to increase conversion rates, shorten sales cycles, and reduce friction across the funnel.
successCriteria: Sales cycle length reduced by a measurable percentage (e.g., 10–20%)
Lead-to-opportunity and opportunity-to-close conversion rates improve quarter-over-quarter
Clear, standardized handoffs exist between Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success

outcomes.name: Data & Insights Enablement
outcomes.description: Ensure the Commercial team has access to accurate, actionable data to guide decision-making and performance management.
successCriteria: Dashboards are live for funnel performance, pipeline health, and revenue forecasting
Data accuracy across GTM systems exceeds 95%
Commercial leaders regularly use dashboards in planning and reviews

outcomes.name: Experimentation & Growth Enablement
outcomes.description: Enable rapid experimentation of GTM strategies, messaging, and channels to identify and scale what drives growth.
successCriteria: At least 1–2 GTM experiments launched per month
Clear experiment results documented with learnings and next steps
Successful experiments are operationalized and scaled within a defined timeframe

mission: Enable a positive, compliant, and efficient employee experience by supporting core People Operations processes and ensuring employees and managers are well-supported throughout the employee lifecycle.

outcomes.name: Employee Lifecycle Operations
outcomes.description: Ensure smooth and timely execution of employee lifecycle processes including onboarding, offboarding, and employee changes.
successCriteria: 100% of new hires complete onboarding within their first week
All employee changes (role, compensation, status) are processed within 2 business days
Offboarding tasks are completed within defined timelines for 95%+ of exits

outcomes.name: Employee Experience & Support
outcomes.description: Provide responsive, accurate, and empathetic support to employee questions and requests related to People policies, benefits, and tools.
successCriteria: Respond to employee PeopleOps inquiries within 1 business day on average
Maintain a 90%+ employee satisfaction score on PeopleOps support interactions
Reduce repeat inquiries by maintaining up-to-date FAQs or documentation

outcomes.name: HR Compliance & Data Accuracy
outcomes.description: Maintain accurate employee records and support compliance with labor laws, company policies, and internal controls.
successCriteria: Maintain 99%+ accuracy across HRIS employee data audits
All required employee documentation is completed and stored on time
Zero missed compliance deadlines related to employment documentation

outcomes.name: People Systems & Process Improvement
outcomes.description: Support and continuously improve PeopleOps systems and processes to increase efficiency and scalability.
successCriteria: Identify and implement at least 1–2 process improvements per quarter
Reduce manual PeopleOps tasks or processing time by at least 10%
Ensure accurate and timely data entry across all People systems

mission: Design, build, and deploy reliable AI/ML solutions that deliver measurable business impact while maintaining high standards of performance, scalability, and responsible AI practices.

outcomes.name: Production-Ready ML Solutions
outcomes.description: Develop and deploy machine learning models that are robust, scalable, and integrated into production systems to solve real business problems.
successCriteria: At least 2–3 ML models deployed to production per year supporting core business use cases
Models meet or exceed agreed performance benchmarks (e.g., accuracy, precision/recall, RMSE)
Production incidents related to ML systems remain below an agreed threshold (e.g., <2 critical incidents per quarter)

outcomes.name: Model Performance & Optimization
outcomes.description: Continuously evaluate, monitor, and improve model performance to ensure sustained value and reliability over time.
successCriteria: Model performance metrics are monitored with automated dashboards and alerts in place
Performance degradation is detected and addressed within defined SLAs
At least one measurable improvement cycle (e.g., retraining, feature enhancement) completed per model per quarter

outcomes.name: Data & Feature Engineering Excellence
outcomes.description: Build high-quality data pipelines and feature engineering processes that enable accurate, repeatable, and explainable ML models.
successCriteria: Data pipelines achieve agreed reliability targets (e.g., >99% successful scheduled runs)
Key features are documented, versioned, and reusable across models
Data quality issues are identified and resolved within defined timelines

outcomes.name: Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing
outcomes.description: Work effectively with cross-functional teams and contribute to a strong AI/ML engineering culture through documentation and knowledge sharing.
successCriteria: Regular collaboration with product, engineering, and data teams resulting in clearly defined ML requirements
Clear technical documentation created for all production ML systems
Active participation in design reviews, code reviews, or internal knowledge-sharing sessions each quarter
